results.title: The Performing bear
results.brief_description: A bankrupt travelling circus, a whip loving trainer, three businessmen, one innocent bear and a chance for freedom. All over the world animals are mistreated in the name of entertainment. Based on a true story, this short animation is about one of those animals, a bear, and his sudden chance for freedom.

results.title: The Perfectionist
results.creator_credit: Chris Thomson, Patricia Lovell and Pavilion Films
results.brief_description: Stuart Gunn (John Waters) is a perfectionist. Barbara (Jacki Weaver) is his long suffering wife. Stuart and Barbara reach a crossroads in their relationship when she wishes to return to the workforce whilst he wants her to stay at home. Finally, Barbara wins out and a babysitter is hired, though not the usual stereotype. He is a tall, blond and handsome Scandinavian called Erik. Without warning the roles of Stuart and Barbara have been reversed - but who is the better off? Starring Jacki Weaver, John Waters, Noel Ferrier and Steven Vidler. Screenplay by David Williamson from his stageplay.

results.title: The Perfection of matter
results.creator_credit: Don Levy, June Goodfield and Nuffield Foundation
results.brief_description: The ideas and traditions of the medieval alchemists. A documentary which describes the techniques and chemical apparatus that have evolved and the changing attitudes of alchemists from scientific to quasi-mystical. Narrated by Stephen Toulmin.

results.title: The Perfect Storm
results.creator_credit: Baltimore Spring Creek Productions, Radiant Productions, Warner Bros. Pictures, Wolfgang Petersen, William Sandell, Erica Edell Phillips, Paula Weinstein, William D. Wittliff and Gail Katz
results.brief_description: In October 1991, a confluence of weather conditions combined to form a killer storm in the North Atlantic. Caught in the storm was the sword-fishing boat Andrea Gail. Magnificent foreshadowing and anticipation fill this true-life drama while minute details of the fishing boats, their gear and the weather are juxtaposed with the sea adventure.

constellations_other.name: Representing disasters
constellations_other.description: The devastating Indian Ocean tsunami was captured by many people on personal devices and home cameras, with the footage broadcast to the world. The event also inspired feature films that are part of a long tradition of disaster films, which often push the boundaries of VFX.

results.title: The Perfect moment
results.creator_credit: Greg MacGillivray and MacGillivray Freeman Films
results.brief_description: Focuses on various skilled athletes as they attain instances of total physical and mental control, when a combination of technique, opportunity, training, drive and environmental conditions product moments of perfection. With Jan-Michael Vincent and narrated by Orson Welles.

results.title: The Perfect hero
results.creator_credit: Barbara Doran, Kent Martin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An insider’s look at the business of romantic fiction writing at Harlequin Publishing. Writers, editors, designers and the male models who pose for the book covers discuss their own roles and the expectations of the readers. Readers discuss the appeal of the romantic genre, and argue its literary merit. Features interviews with writers Barbara Cartland, Virginia Henley and Heather Graham.

results.title: The Perfect English village
results.creator_credit: Nigel Farrell, WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.) and VATV
results.brief_description: Producer/director/author and broadcaster Nigel Farrell leaves the chaos of the city in his Morris-Minor in search of the perfect, tranquil, village. Does it exist? Nigel is determined to find out. On his mission he locates beautiful villages in Sussex, Wiltshire, Devon, Essex and North Yorkshire, none of which seems to fit his impression of the perfect village. Nigel does eventually solve the puzzle of a tranquil idyll, but not where you expect it.

results.title: The Percussions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Instruments of the band and orchestra”.
Explains that percussion instruments emphasise rhythm and provide special sound effects in marching bands, concert bands and orchestras. Includes demonstrations of the bass drum, snare drum, field drum, tympani, cymbals, tambourine, temple blocks, triangle, castanets, claves, gong, marimba, bells and chimes.

group.title: Instruments of the band and orchestra

results.title: The Perception of life
results.brief_description: A history of the microscope. Deals with the evolution of ideas about the smallest units of life and the relation between what a scientist sees and the theories he creates. It begins with the work of the early microscopist and ends with our current theories of DNA and viruses. Narrated by Stephen Toulmin.
